validateDecimalValue

public static void validateDecimalValue(java.lang.String value)
                                 throws org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException
Validates whether the input dimension value just contains digital numbers. Exception will be thrown out when the letter occurred in the input value is not "." or ",".

Parameters:
value - dimension value
Throws:
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException - if the value input is not valid.

validateUnit

public static java.lang.String validateUnit(java.lang.String value)
                                     throws org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException
Validates the a dimension string. And return the the unit string of it.

Parameters:
value - the value to be validated.
Returns:
Unit name of the dimension. null if no unit specified.
Throws:
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException - if the unit is not in the list.

doParse

public static org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.DimensionValue doParse(java.lang.String value,
                                                                                boolean localeDependent,
                                                                                com.ibm.icu.util.ULocale locale)
                                                                         throws org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException
Parses a dimension string.

Parameters:
value - the dimension string to parse
localeDependent - true means that the string needs to be parsed in locale-dependent way.
Returns:
a dimension object representing the dimension string.
Throws:
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.PropertyValueException - if the string is not valid

isValidUnit

public static boolean isValidUnit(java.lang.String unit)
Returns whether the given unit is valid.

Parameters:
unit - the unit to check
Returns:
true if the unit is valid; return false otherwise.
